newsitem.title: FRANCE: France Telecom white-collar staff support selloff.
newsitem.headline: France Telecom white-collar staff support selloff.

text.p: The CGC staff union at France Telecom said on Wednesday that the partial privatisation of the company was "inevitable" and urged the new Socialist-led government to go ahead with the sale.
The partial privatisation of France Telecom is suspended awaiting a decision by the government, due to be named on Wednesday.
The outgoing centre-right government had planned to sell a 30 to 35 percent stake starting June 4 to raise some 50 billion francs ($8.6 billion).

"We hope that we do not have to wait too long before the government takes a decision, taking into consideration the future of France Telecom. Too much time has already been lost and France Telecom is already behind on its rivals," the union said in a statement.
"The staff demand responsible decisions and new delays do not change much for the unavoidable issue," it added.

Other labour unions are mixed with the Socialist-leaning CFDT not excluding a partial sale while Sud is against. Force Ouvriere leader Marc Blondel said he was not hostile to a partial selloff and the Communist-led CGT is against any privatisations.
On Tuesday, France Telecom chairman Michel Bon told the group's workers in an internal voice message that the suspension of the sale was not good news, but not catastrophic either.
"Our main focus is January 1, 1998. The start of full competition," Bon said. ($ = 5.837 French Francs)
